abstract: To get his out-of-pocket expenses reimbursed, Carl C. Icahn must agree to refrain from running a proxy fight against Dell’s board or filing a lawsuit against the company, according to a letter sent to him by a special committee of Dell’s board.
snippet: To get his out-of-pocket expenses reimbursed, Carl C. Icahn must agree to refrain from running a proxy fight against Dell’s board or filing a lawsuit against the company, according to a letter sent to him by a special committee of Dell’s board.
lead_paragraph: A special committee of Dell‘s board offered on Friday to reimburse Carl C. Icahn up to $25 million worth of expenses tied to a possible bid for the computer company – provided that he plays nicely.

headline.main: Dell Offers to Reimburse Icahn for Deal Work, With Strings Attached

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
